page.title: 07VICARAGE
page.content: One of the big houses in our area is marked on our map as Vic. This is the Vicarage. It was biult in Victorian days and is a very big house with lots of rooms and cellars. There are also stables but there are no horses in them. The building is made of stone and the gutters are painted red. There is a big garden and an orchard. There are lots of trees to climb and good places to hide. The Vicar of Chittlehampton used to live here. When the Vicar, Sub-Dean J.H.B. Andrews, died in September 1984 the Vicarage was cleared and in March 1985 it was sold for Â£97,000. It is now lived in by the minister of the Umberleigh Christian Fellowship which has its chapel just over the river bridge at Umberleigh. There is also a Christian Youth Club that meets here.
